revised_title: Karl Pearson's Contributions to the Mathematical Theory of Evolution
tldr: This article discusses the mathematical theory of evolution and its application to biological data. The author, Karl Pearson, introduces the concept of frequency curves and their importance in understanding the variation and evolution of species. He also presents a method for dissecting abnormal frequency curves into components, which can help estimate the number of contributing factors and the odds of an element's persistence.
